docs.text: scream 2 , like its predecessor , is a genre-crossing film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is about 50% horror film and 50% murder mystery .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the mix worked very well last time and it continues to entertain this time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: scream was also known for its self-referential tone .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: many inside jokes were made in reference to horror movies and wes craven .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: again , scream 2 follows suit with characters saying such things as " sequels suck " and " the entire horror genre was destroyed by sequels . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: scream 2's story is very similar to it's predecessor's .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sidney ( neve campbell ) , having survived the killing spree in scream , is now in college .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: gale weathers ( courteney cox ) has written a book about the murders and that book is now being released as a feature film , called stab ( which for all practical purposes is the real-world movie scream ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at the premiere of stab , two students from sidney's college are stabbed to death , and a new story begins .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the press descends on sidney and her college to get the scoop on this sequel killer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they want to know all about the links between stab , sidney , and the recent murders .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the most complex self-reference i saw ( this should be an olympic event ) was the scene where gale weathers was asking questions at a press conference .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the rest of the press was watching and videotaping weathers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the other survivors from scream were watching and videotaping the press .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the audience was watching the whole , filmed scene .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( whew . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie is packed with layers and self-references that make it a pleasure to watch .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even better would be to watch a double feature of scream and scream 2 . that's not to say that these references necessarily make scream 2 a deep , or even a good movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the just add to the fun of watching it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i recommend it for other reasons as well .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what i liked best about the horror aspect of the movie is that the monster is not supernatural .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: no werewolf or ghost or psycho with superhuman strength is responsible .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is a person in a mask and a robe , his only advantage the fear he strikes into his victims .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: no extraordinary leap of faith is needed to believe in the killer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the down side is that if you are frightened by horror movies , you have less grounds to say " it's just a movie . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the whodunit aspect of the movie is not that great by itself - gale weathers and deputy dewey ( david arquette , also from the original ) track down a killer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they are likeable , but not outstanding .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but in combination with the horror aspect , the whodunit is a perfect counterpoint .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it was exactly a year ago today that i wrote the review for scream .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the internet movie database says that scream 3 is in the works , so i wonder if i'll be doing the same thing on january 1 , 1999 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if craven and screenwriter kevin williamson are able to keep the quality high , i'll be happy to mark my calendar .
docs.label: positive
